intro: Monolena bracteata, commonly known as the bracted monolena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with small, lance-shaped leaves arranged alternately along the stem. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. Monolena bracteata is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
